title: Shawl Border, early 19th century
medium:
Medium: wool, silk
Technique: tapestry woven
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 62.5 x 140 cm (24 5/8 x 55 1/8 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund
description: Horizontal row of large stylized decorated cones with leafy edges; broad guard border on four sides consisting of octagonal medallions, each framing floral spray, and oak leaves between. Broad border at top with a row of decorated mounds with flowery sprays growing on and in them. Small cypress shape in center of each and between each. Great variety of colors on white ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Shawl Border, early 19th century.
early 19th century. Medium: wool, silk
Technique: tapestry woven. Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund. 1954-54-2.
